Jim O'Flaherty, Jr. wrote:

>So, Jeff - Does your definition of a "static neural network" include 
>recurrence?
>  
>
I would assume so since Jeff was making the point that NAND gates can be 
used to build any logic circuit and these circuits (in CPU's etc) often 
utilise 'recurrent' connections. In fact one such circuit using 
recurrency is indeed the flip-flop!(there are a few variations) - which 
can be used as the basis for storing data.

Colin.
